name: Tracker

fields.name: configuration
fields.documentation: Configuration settings such as the consumer name.

fields.name: current
fields.documentation: Thread-local variable that holds the current tracker instance. This is automatically set by the Fluxzero Java SDK.

fields.name: messageBatch
fields.documentation: The current batch being processed, including segment and position metadata.

fields.name: messageType
fields.documentation: The type of messages being consumed (e.g., {@code EVENT}, {@code COMMAND}).

fields.name: topic
fields.documentation:
The topic being tracked if {@code messageType} is {@link MessageType#CUSTOM} or {@link MessageType#DOCUMENT}.
 Otherwise, {@code null}.

fields.name: trackerId
fields.documentation: An identifier for the current tracker instance.

methods.name: canHandle
methods.documentation:
When the consumer is configured with {@code ignoreSegment=true}, segment filtering is performed client-side. This method uses the current {@link MessageBatch} to determine whether a given message should be processed by the current tracker, based on:
  • The segment range of the batch
  • The index of the message relative to the current {@link Position}
@param message The message to check @param routingKey The routing key to base the check on

methods.name: current
methods.documentation: Returns the current tracker instance, if any.

methods.name: getName
methods.documentation: Returns the name of the consumer associated with this tracker.
